name: AFC Sunderland History Quiz | UK Football Teams | 10 Questions

questions.text: In which year were the club formed?
questions.explanation:
1879.

	Sunderland were formed as Sunderland and District Teachers' Association Football Club in 1879, but just a year later changed to Sunderland AFC.

questions.text: Where did Sunderland first call their home ground?
questions.explanation:
Blue House Field.

	Sunderland played at Blue House Field between 1879-82, then moved to Grove's Field for one year. Horatio Street were their next home between 1882-84, followed by Abb's Field (1883-86), and Newcastle Road between 1895-98. The club spent 100 years at Roker Park, before moving to the Stadium of Light in 1997.

questions.text: Who was Sunderland's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
Tom Watson.

	Watson was Sunderland manager between 1888-96, followed by Campbell until 1899, Mackie (1899-1905), and Kyle (1905-28). Other Sunderland managers include Lawrie McMenemy, Bob Stokoe, Terry Butcher, and Howard Wilkinson.

questions.text: What was the nickname bestowed upon Sunderland after moving to the Stadium of Light?
questions.explanation:
The Black Cats.

	The club had asked the supporters to provide the nickname and the choice went down to the four listed, plus 'the Sols'. The nickname goes back further than that, derived from a gun battery through to a 'mascot' at Roker Park.

questions.text: Where did Sunderland sign Brian Deane from in 2005?
questions.explanation:
Leeds United.

	Deane has played for many a club during his career, including Doncaster Rovers, Sheffield United, Leeds United, Benfica, Middlesbrough, Leicester City, and West Ham United. Of those listed, he played for Leeds and Sheffield United twice.

questions.text: In which season did Sunderland first win the Football League title?
questions.explanation:
1891-92.

	In the 1891-92 season, Sunderland finished as champions of the League by winning every home game, and losing only five away from home. They finished five points ahead of Preston North End in second place.

questions.text: Which of these played the most League games for the club?
questions.explanation:
Jim Montgomery.

	Montgomery played 537 times in the League for Sunderland between 1962-77. Robson played 174 times, Gates made 199 League appearances, and Shackleton notched 348 League games.

questions.text: When Sunderland won the 1998-99 League Division One title, how many points did they gain?
questions.explanation:
105.

	Sunderland amassed an incredible 105 points out of a possible 138 that season, losing just three times to win the title, and gain promotion into the Premier League.

questions.text: In the 1996-97 season, Sunderland played in the Premiership for the first time. Which of these scored their first goal in the Premier League?
questions.explanation:
Michael Gray.

	Sunderland beat Nottingham Forest 4-1 away from home in their second game of the season, with Gray, Quinn (2), and Ord on the scoresheet. Sunderland would go on to be relegated that season, along with Forest and Middlesbrough.

questions.text: Who did Sunderland beat to set the record for their biggest League win in 1908?
questions.explanation:
Newcastle United.

	Sunderland beat their main rivals, Newcastle, 9-1 in a Division one fixture in December, 1908. Ironically, Newcastle won the title that season, with Sunderland finishing third.
